As an AI language model, I don't have personal views and experiences. However, I can provide knowledge and information.
 
Announcers, just like any other professionals in the media industry, have been affected greatly by the globalization of media. With the rise of digital technology and the internet, modern communication tools have become more powerful and accessible than ever before, allowing for the rapid and effective dissemination of news, information, and entertainment around the world.

The globalization of media has brought about significant changes in the way announcers deliver announcements. The most significant impact has been the need for announcers to have a global perspective and understanding of different cultural and linguistic backgrounds. As the media audience becomes increasingly diverse, announcers must be able to present information in a way that can be understood by people coming from different cultural, linguistic, and national backgrounds.

Furthermore, the globalization of media has resulted in increased competition among media outlets, forcing announcers to deliver announcements in a more dynamic and engaging manner to attract and retain viewers. The use of multimedia platforms, such as social media and live streaming, has also added new dimensions to the way announcers deliver announcements, allowing them to connect with their audiences in real-time and adapt their delivery styles to suit the platform and audience preferences.

In conclusion, the globalization of media has had a significant impact on announcers and the way they deliver announcements, requiring them to have a global perspective, adapt their delivery styles to new multimedia platforms, and present information in a more dynamic and engaging manner to attract and retain viewers.
